| A brood wasp:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* can [lay eggs](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY"). |                                                                                                                        |

The **brood wasp**, a, is a [defunct](/wiki/Defunct_features_\(SpliceHack\) "Defunct features (SpliceHack)") monster in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), which has since been replaced by [ichneumon](/wiki/Ichneumon "Ichneumon"). Brood wasps were very fast, and possessed attacks that were very dangerous to unprepared players.

Upon hitting a player that is not [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned") with its inject larvae attack, there was a one in four chance that the brood wasp injected larvae into the creature. This was denoted by the message `The brood wasp injects something into you!`. 100-300 turns later, the player would take 10d4 damage as 2-4 **baby brood wasps** hatch from their body. Carrying brood wasp larvae was considered a [major trouble](/wiki/Major_trouble "Major trouble") for purposes of [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer"), and could be cured via application of a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn").

Brood wasps and players [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into brood wasps had a one in four chance of injecting larvae upon hitting a monster with 5 or less hit points. Upon doing so, if the attacker was the player, a [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") baby brood wasp would be created. Otherwise, the monster was instantly slain.

## Strategy

Due to their high speed, poisonous sting, and ability to create tame monsters, a brood wasp could be a useful monster to polymorph into, especially in the early game.

## Encyclopedia Entry

These insects are feared for their ability to lay eggs inside  
the bodies of their prey.

This page was automatically generated by a modified version of nhtohtml version 2.05w

From NetHackWiki

a baby brood wasp
Difficulty 6
Attacks Sting 2d3 poisonous (dexterity)
a baby brood wasp
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Sting 2d3 poisonous (dexterity)

Base level 3
Base experience 35
Speed 18
Base AC -1
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 30
Nutritional value 30
Size Small
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed poison (20%)

A baby brood wasp:

  • can fly.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is normally generated hostile.

a brood wasp
Difficulty 12
Attacks Sting 2d3 poisonous (dexterity), Sting 2d3 inject larvae
a brood wasp
Difficulty 12
Attacks

Sting 2d3 poisonous (dexterity), Sting 2d3 inject larvae

Base level 8
Base experience 162
Speed 18
Base AC -1
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 100
Nutritional value 100
Size Large
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed poison (53%)

A brood wasp:

  • can fly.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.

The brood wasp, a, is a defunct monster in SpliceHack, which has since been replaced by ichneumon. Brood wasps were very fast, and possessed attacks that were very dangerous to unprepared players.

Upon hitting a player that is not thick-skinned with its inject larvae attack, there was a one in four chance that the brood wasp injected larvae into the creature. This was denoted by the message The brood wasp injects something into you!. 100-300 turns later, the player would take 10d4 damage as 2-4 baby brood wasps hatch from their body. Carrying brood wasp larvae was considered a major trouble for purposes of prayer, and could be cured via application of a unicorn horn.

Brood wasps and players polymorphed into brood wasps had a one in four chance of injecting larvae upon hitting a monster with 5 or less hit points. Upon doing so, if the attacker was the player, a tame baby brood wasp would be created. Otherwise, the monster was instantly slain.

Strategy

Due to their high speed, poisonous sting, and ability to create tame monsters, a brood wasp could be a useful monster to polymorph into, especially in the early game.

Encyclopedia Entry

These insects are feared for their ability to lay eggs inside
the bodies of their prey.

Otherwise, the monster was instantly slain. == Strategy == Due to their high speed, poisonous sting, and ability to create tame monsters, a brood wasp could be a useful monster to polymorph into, especially in the early game. ==Encyclopedia Entry== {{encyclopedia| These insects are feared for their ability to lay eggs inside the bodies of their prey.}} This page was automatically generated by a modified version of nhtohtml version 2.05w [[Category:Defunct features (SpliceHack)]]
